Zend Deployment.name: Zend Deployment
Zend Deployment.shortDescription: Allows packaging, deployment, and updating of a PHP applications
Zend Deployment.longDescription: Zend Deployment allows you to package an application and deploy it using Zend Server, making it available for users on the Web.

zend_deployment.log_rotation_size.shortDescription: The maximum size of the log file before it is rotated.

zend_deployment.auto_download.shortDescription: When enabled, will allow application package download when triggered by user

Zend Code Tracing.name: Zend Code Tracing
Zend Code Tracing.shortDescription: Enables real-time execution trace recording of PHP requests
Zend Code Tracing.longDescription: Zend Server Code Tracing is an in-depth diagnostic tool that allows you to drill-down to the function level to view actual performance-related information and statistics.

zend_codetracing.buffer_size.shortDescription: The size of the trace memory buffer.

zend_codetracing.max_string.shortDescription: The maximal length of string values to store in trace files. Longer strings will be truncated.

zend_codetracing.max_depth.shortDescription: The maximal depth of arrays to store in trace files. Deeper nesting levels will not be stored.

zend_codetracing.max_elements.shortDescription: The maximal number of array elements to store in trace files. Longer arrays will be truncated.

zend_codetracing.dump_file.shortDescription: The file path and name prefix for saving trace files, relative to zend.data_dir.

zend_codetracing.trace_includes.shortDescription: Enable tracing include and require calls.

zend_codetracing.dump_on_segv.shortDescription: Save tracing data if a fatal signal (e.g. a segmentation fault) is raised.

zend_codetracing.max_freq.shortDescription: Amount of time in seconds to wait between consecutive Code Tracing data writes.

zend_codetracing.log_file.shortDescription: Log file for the Code Tracing module (relative to the log dir).

zend_codetracing.override_functions.shortDescription: List of internal functions to Trace.

zend_codetracing.max_concurrent_trace_bu.shortDescription: Number of concurrent trace buffer allocated.

zend_codetracing.log_rotation_size.shortDescription: The maximal size of the log file before it is rotated.

zend_codetracing.use_fast_timestamp.shortDescription: Use cycles-based time caclculation. Set to false only if you have a problem with frequency probe.

zend_codetracing.max_disk_space.shortDescription: Maximum disk space for trace files.

Zend Data Cache.name: Zend Data Cache
Zend Data Cache.shortDescription: Caches application data of various data types using PHP APIs
Zend Data Cache.longDescription: The Zend Data Cache is used to cache different types of data (e.g., strings, arrays and objects), as well as script output or script output elements for various durations. Items can be stored in shared memory (SHM) or to disk.

zend_datacache.shm.memory_cache_size.shortDescription: Amount of shared memory to be used by a single namespace.

zend_datacache.shm.memory_cache_size_kb.shortDescription: Amount of shared memory to be used by a single namespace (in KiB).

zend_datacache.shm.max_num_namespaces.shortDescription: Maximum number of namespaces that Data Cache will allocate.

zend_datacache.disk.save_path.shortDescription: The path for storing cached content to the disk

zend_datacache.enable.shortDescription:
Enables the Data Cache. The Data Cache cannot work without this directive. 
				The Data Cache can be turned on or off from the User Interface

zend_datacache.lock_on_expire.shortDescription:
Enables the lock on expire mechanism. 
				This is ON by default and should stay that way for performance reasons.

zend_datacache.apc_compatibility.shortDescription: When enabled, the Data Cache extension registers APC compatibility methods.

zend_datacache.log_rotation_size.shortDescription: The maximum size of the log file before it is rotated.

Zend Debugger.name: Zend Debugger
Zend Debugger.shortDescription: Enables remote debugging of PHP scripts with Zend Studio
Zend Debugger.longDescription: The Zend Debugger communicates with the Zend (PHP) Engine to retrieve runtime information and present it in Zend Studio for root cause analysis purposes.

zend_debugger.allow_hosts.shortDescription: Specifies the hosts that are allowed to connect (hostmask list) with Zend Debugger when running a remote debug session with Zend Studio

zend_debugger.deny_hosts.shortDescription: Specifies the hosts that are not allowed to connect (hostmask list) with the Zend Debugger when running a remote debug session with Zend Studio

zend_debugger.allow_tunnel.shortDescription: A list of hosts (hostmask list) that can use the machine on which Zend Server is installed to create a communication tunnel for remote debgging with Zend Studio. This is done to solve firewall connectivity limitations

zend_debugger.max_msg_size.shortDescription: The maximum message size accepted by the Zend Debugger for protocol network messages

zend_debugger.httpd_uid.shortDescription: The user ID of the httpd process that runs the Zend Debugger (only for tunneling)

zend_debugger.tunnel_min_port.shortDescription: A range of ports that the communication tunnel can use. This defines the minimum value for the range

zend_debugger.tunnel_max_port.shortDescription: A range of ports that the communication tunnel can use. This defines the maximum value for the range

zend_debugger.expose_remotely.shortDescription: Define whether to expose the presence of the Zend Debugger to remote clients

validation.listValues: a:3:{i:0;s:11:"Always Hide";i:1;s:28:"Expose only to Allowed Hosts";i:2;s:13:"Always Expose";}

zend_debugger.passive_mode_timeout.shortDescription: The Debugger's timeout period (in seconds) to wait for a response from the client (Zend Studio)

zend_debugger.debug_extensions.shortDescription: Supported PHP file extensions for debugging. If the suffix does not appear here, the file is ignored

zend_debugger.xdebug_compatible_coverage.shortDescription: Directive in order to mock up xdebug coverage

zend_debugger.use_fast_timestamp.shortDescription: Enables fast time sampling which is dependent on CPU cycles and frequency, otherwise, the directive uses operating system timing (which may be less accurate)

zend_debugger.enable_coverage.shortDescription: Enable code-coverage feature, should only be true on local debugger

Zend Extension Manager.name: Zend Extension Manager
Zend Extension Manager.longDescription: Because every Zend extension is compiled for each PHP version, the ZEM selects the proper extension version, depending on the PHP runtime. In addition, the ZEM exposes the C language API that reflects all the information for the managed extensions and is responsible for managing the licences of these extensions.

zend_extension_manager.log_rotation_size.shortDescription: The maximum size of the log file before it is rotated

zend_extension_manager.load_order_file.shortDescription: The path to the location of the load file. The load file contains the information about the extensions' loading order

zend_extension_manager.activate_signal_h.shortDescription: UNIX only: Activates SIGSEGV and SIGABRT signal handlers.

zend_extension_manager.recheck_license_i.shortDescription: Interval to check for license updates (in seconds). Set it to 0 to disable license checking.

zend_extension_manager.wait_for_debugger.shortDescription: UNIX only: Automatically pauses the process received by SIGSEGV and SIGABRT.

Zend Guard Loader.name: Zend Guard Loader
Zend Guard Loader.shortDescription: Loads and runs PHP scripts that are encoded with Zend Guard
Zend Guard Loader.longDescription: The Zend Guard Loader is a PHP extension that runs outputs created by Zend Guard, which provides an easy way to encode, obfuscate and license PHP code via an Eclipse-based interface or from the command line.

zend_loader.enable.shortDescription: Enables loading encoded scripts. The default value is On

zend_loader.obfuscation_level_support.shortDescription: The Obfuscation level supported by Zend Guard Loader. The levels are detailed in the official Zend Guard Documentation

zend_loader.license_path.shortDescription:
Path to where licensed Zend products should look for the product license. 
				For more information on how to create a license file, see the Zend Guard User Guide

Zend Java Bridge.name: Zend Java Bridge
Zend Java Bridge.shortDescription: Enables integration of Java code in PHP applications
Zend Java Bridge.longDescription: The Zend Java Bridge provides PHP developers with a way to use existing Java code and build PHP applications that use Java code. The Java Bridge integrates Java code in PHP by connecting the PHP object system with the Java Bridge object system.

zend_jbridge.server_port.shortDescription: The TCP port on which the server is listening.

zend_jbridge.ints_are_longs.shortDescription: Converts PHP integers into java.lang.Long integers, primarily for 64-bit machines.

zend_jbridge.encoding.shortDescription: Sets the encoding type that is passed from PHP to Java.

zend_jbridge.use_java_objects.shortDescription: Uses basic Java objects and does not attempt to convert them to primitives.

zend_jbridge.server_ip.shortDescription: The TCP ip on which the server is listening.

Zend Job Queue.name: Zend Job Queue
Zend Job Queue.shortDescription: Provides offline asynchronous processing of tasks and activities
Zend Job Queue.longDescription: Zend Server's Job Queue is a monitored, manageable job queuing system, which can be easily integrated with PHP applications. It provides the ability to take certain tasks preformed by your PHP applications off-line, and queue them to execute asynchronously, or even at a later time or in a recurring manner.

zend_jobqueue.daemon_connection_timeout.shortDescription: The default connection timeout to the Job Queue Daemon.

zend_jobqueue.default_binding.shortDescription: Default binding to the Job Queue Daemon.

zend_jobqueue.log_rotation_size.shortDescription: The maximum size of the log file before it is rotated.

Zend Monitor.name: Zend Monitor
Zend Monitor.shortDescription: Provides an alerting mechanism for a variety of types of PHP script problems
Zend Monitor.longDescription: The Zend Monitor is a Zend Server component that integrates into the PHP runtime environment and watches for various events such as errors, failing functions, slow scripts, database errors, etc. When an event occurs, the Zend Monitor collects and reports all the relevant debugging information.

zend_monitor.enable.shortDescription: Enables or disables the Monitor component.

zend_monitor.log_rotation_size.shortDescription: The maximum size of the log file before it is rotated.

zend_monitor.shm_size.shortDescription: Amount of shared memory to allocate for event collection.

zend_monitor.events_transport_parameter.shortDescription: Communication transport for event reporting to the Monitor Node.

zend_monitor.report_super_globals.shortDescription: PHP Super-global variables to include in event reports.

zend_monitor.security_black_list.shortDescription: PHP Super-global values that should not be included in Zend Monitor events.

zend_monitor.super_globals_to_secure.shortDescription: PHP Super-globals to pass through the security black-list filter.

zend_monitor.max_super_globals_string_le.shortDescription: The maximum length of a superglobal to include in an event report.

zend_monitor.event.request_slow_exec.dis.shortDescription: Disable reporting of Slow Request Execution events if a Slow Function Execution event was reported.

Sets the load level to disable Slow Request Execution events for the same request that
				already triggered a high load event.

zend_monitor.event.request_relative_slow.shortDescription: The minimum request execution time for a relativity check.

zend_monitor.event.request_relative_larg.shortDescription: The minimum request memory usage for a relativity check.
The minimum request output size for a relativity check

zend_monitor.event.zend_error.silence_le.shortDescription: Controls PHP Error event reporting when PHP error reporting is supressed

zend_monitor.requests_statistics.warmup_.shortDescription:
How many requests to run before deviation events are calculated (to collect
				data for the average). This is used to calculate averages for relative events.

zend_monitor.requests_statistics.request.shortDescription: The time duration (in seconds) before statistics are reset if a request is not called.

zend_monitor.aggregation.ttl.shortDescription: The time duration (in seconds) before resetting the aggregation data if the aggregation-key for an event is not triggered.

zend_monitor.aggregation.max_reporting_i.shortDescription: The maximum time interval between reporting.

zend_monitor.use_fast_timestamp.shortDescription: Enables fast time sampling which is dependent on CPU cycles and frequency, otherwise, the directive uses operating system timing (which may be less accurate).

zend_monitor.event_tracing_mode.shortDescription: Determines integration with tracer mechanism in case of events that require a trace data dump.

zend_monitor.aggregate_by_url_query.shortDescription: When enabled, use the URL's query string as part of the aggregation key.

zend_monitor.function_error_resolvers.shortDescription: A list of functions that can retrieve the error string of the corresponding function that returned error.

zend_monitor.event_generate_trace_file.shortDescription: When enabled, an event will also trigger a code-tracing file generation.

zend_monitor.send_request_id.shortDescription: When enabled, a cookie that represents the current request will be send to browser. Only needed for toolbar.

Zend Monitor UI.name: Zend Monitor UI
Zend Monitor UI.longDescription:
The Zend Monitor UI extension is used by Zend Server to query the
		Monitor's database for event information - This API is not for end-users.

zend_monitor_ui.enabled.shortDescription: Enables the Zend Monitor UI extension.

zend_monitor_ui.log_rotation_size.shortDescription: The maximum size of the log file before it is rotated.

zend_monitor.commands_transport_paramete.shortDescription: Network parameter for commands to the Monitor Node.

zend_monitor_ui.expiration_days_closed.shortDescription: All "Closed" or "Ignored" issues that did not re-occur for more than expiration_days_closed will be deleted.

zend_monitor_ui.expiration_days.shortDescription: All issues that did not re-occur for more than expiration_days will be deleted.

Zend Page Cache.name: Zend Page Cache
Zend Page Cache.shortDescription: Improves application performance by conditionally caching PHP scripts output
Zend Page Cache.longDescription: The Zend Page Cache improves PHP application performance by caching the entire output of PHP scripts (HTML, XML, etc.), while still maintaining dynamic capabilities through an elaborate rules system.

zend_pagecache.enable.shortDescription: Enables the Zend Page Cache extension.

zend_pagecache.save_path.shortDescription: Location for saved cache files. This must point to an existing location.

zend_pagecache.dir_depth.shortDescription: Depth of directory tree in which cached files are stored.

zend_pagecache.dependencies_file.shortDescription: The location of the configuration file in which caching rules are stored.

zend_pagecache.compression_enable.shortDescription: Enables file compression of cached output.

zend_pagecache.clean_frequency.shortDescription: How often expired entries are removed from the cache. The cleaning frequency is configured in seconds.

zend_pagecache.log_rotation_size.shortDescription: The maximum size of the log file before it is rotated.

zend_pagecache.max_cached_rules.shortDescription: The maximum number of entries allowed for the internal URL-rule cache.

zend_pagecache.ordered_rule_matching.shortDescription: Order rules matching according to rules names.

Zend Cluster Utils.name: Zend Cluster Utils
Zend Cluster Utils.shortDescription: The ZendClusterUtils runs PHP scripts periodically.
Zend Cluster Utils.longDescription: The ZendClusterUtils runs PHP scripts periodically. It allows execution of background tasks as cleanup

zend_cluster_utils.log_verbosity_level.shortDescription: Sets the log verbosity level of ZendClusterUtils logs [0-5]

Zend Session Clustering.name: Zend Session Clustering
Zend Session Clustering.shortDescription: Provides a transparent and scalable solution for PHP session storage
Zend Session Clustering.longDescription: Zend Server's Session Clustering provides a transparent and scalable solution for PHP session storage. It is designed to provide good performance and high scalability - making sure clusters can grow without session storage becoming a bottleneck.

zend_sc.scd_port.shortDescription: The port the SC daemon is listening to.

zend_sc.use_unix_sockets.shortDescription: Communication with mod cluster: 0 TCP, 1 Unix socket.

zend_sc.unix_socket_filename.shortDescription: Unix socket filename to communicate with daemon.

zend_sc.quick_connect_timeout.shortDescription: Timeout value for the check daemon status API.

zend_sc.lock_retry_timeout.shortDescription: Used when retrying to access locked sessions.

zend_sc.log_rotation_size.shortDescription: Size of log before it's rotated.

zend_sc.session_compression_enabled.shortDescription: When enabled, compress the sessions' data before passing it to the session clustering daemon.

Zend Statistics.name: Zend Statistics
Zend Statistics.shortDescription: Keeps track of a variety of server and application performance metrics
Zend Statistics.longDescription: Zend Statistics collects information on how applications and servers are performing, and displays related data statistics in the user interface.

zend_statistics.optimizerplus.enable.shortDescription: Enables statistics gathering for O+. Data available via WebAPI only.

zend_statistics.pagecache.enable.shortDescription: Enables statistics gathering for Page Cache. Data available via WebAPI only.

zend_statistics.datacache.enable.shortDescription: Enables statistics gathering for Data Cache. Data available via WebAPI only.

zend_statistics.report_interval_daily.shortDescription: When to flush statistics information for the daily entries.

zend_statistics.report_interval_weekly.shortDescription: When to flush statistics information for the weekly entries.

zend_statistics.report_interval_monthly.shortDescription: When to flush statistics information for the monthly entries.

zend_statistics.history_daily.shortDescription: Time range for storing daily entries.

zend_statistics.history_weekly.shortDescription: Time range for storing weekly entries.

zend_statistics.history_monthly.shortDescription: Time range for storing monthly entries.

Unclassified.name: Unclassified
Unclassified.longDescription: Directives that are not known to Zend Server

zend.database.host_name.shortDescription: Hostname of the Database machine (server db only)

zend.database.port.shortDescription: Port of the Databse (server db only)

zend.database.user.shortDescription: User-name to connect to the database (server db only)

zend.database.password.shortDescription: Password to connect to the database (server db only)

Zend Download Server.name: Zend Download Server
Zend Download Server.shortDescription: Improves Apache scalability by passing on static content downloads
Zend Download Server.longDescription: The Zend Download Server is a PHP extension that forks an HTTP server separate from Apache to be used for serving large files of given types by redirecting regular requests from your Apache to a separate server.

zend_dserver.enable.shortDescription:
Enables or disables the Zend Download Server (ZDS) component. 
				This can also be done in Zend Server, from Server Setup | Components. 
				When turned to 'On', the ZDS passes downloads to a dedicated process. 
				When turned to 'Off', all downloads are handled by the Apache server

zend_dserver.mime_types_file.shortDescription: The full path to the MIME type file.

zend_dserver.log_file.shortDescription: The location of the Zend Download Server (ZDS) log file

zend_dserver.min_file_size.shortDescription: The minimal file size that can be served via a ZDS process. Smaller files are served via Apache

zend_dserver.nice.shortDescription: The ZDS process priority level. The lower the number, the higher the priority the process is given.

zend_dserver.disable_byterange.shortDescription: Disables handling byte-range requests. All requests return an entire file

zend_dserver.etag_params.shortDescription: The file attributes that are taken as part of an etag.

zend_dserver.mmap_chunk.shortDescription: The size of the data chunks that are read from the file into the socket.

zend_dserver.use_sendfile.shortDescription: Enable use of sendfile() backend. It can significantly improve performence

zend_dserver.debug_headers.shortDescription: Put some headers that might be interesting when testing

Zend Global Directives.name: Zend Global Directives
Zend Global Directives.longDescription: Directives that start from zend.* are used by every extension from any Zend products line.

zend.conf_dir.shortDescription: The directory all configuration files are stored in

zend.pid_dir.shortDescription: The directory all *.pid files are stored in

zend.temp_dir.shortDescription: The directory all temporary files are stored in

zend.log_dir.shortDescription: The directory all log files are stored in

zend.data_dir.shortDescription: The directory all log files are stored in

zend.ini_scandir.shortDescription: The directory where PHP configuration files are located

zend.monitor_transport_parameter.shortDescription: Network parameter for Event reporting to the Monitor Node

zend.webapi_key.shortDescription: The name of WebApi key to use

zend.user_webserver_ip.shortDescription: The IP address on which the user's webserver is listening

zend.user_webserver_port.shortDescription: The port number on which the user's webserver is listening

zend.monitor_generate_unique_events.shortDescription: When set, each event generated by the Monitor is generated as a unique event (i.e. it will be shown as a new event)

zend.monitor_disable_event_buffering.shortDescription: When set, all monitor events are immediately reported to the database (affects performance)

zend.deployment_daemon_port.shortDescription: The port on which Deployment Daemon accepts requests (the IP is always on loopback, i.e. 127.0.0.1)

Zend Utils.name: Zend Utils
Zend Utils.shortDescription: Exposes the Zend Extension Manager's API
Zend Utils.longDescription: The Zend Utils extension takes you one step further and makes the Zend Extension Manager's API usable from a PHP runtime environment.

zend_utils.log_verbosity_level.shortDescription: Sets the log verbosity level of Zend Utilis logs [0-5]

zend_utils.use_graceful_restart.shortDescription: Restart API uses a graceful restart

zend_utils.enable_crash_dumps.shortDescription: Create mini dumps when a crash occurs

zend_utils.enable_crash_breaks.shortDescription: Break and wait for debugger when a crash occurs

apache2handler.name: apache2handler
apache2handler.longDescription: This extension provides the Apache 2 mod_php SAPI.

engine.shortDescription: Enables the PHP scripting language engine under Apache

child_terminate.shortDescription: Specify whether PHP scripts may request child process termination on end of

last_modified.shortDescription: Send PHP scripts modification date as Last-Modified

xbithack.shortDescription: Parse files with executable bit set as PHP regardless of their file ending

apc.name: apc
apc.longDescription: The Alternative PHP Cache (APC) is a free and open opcode cache for PHP. It was conceived of to provide a free, open, and robust framework for caching and optimizing PHP intermediate code.

apc.enabled.shortDescription: apc.enabled can be set to 0 to disable APC

APC Compatibility Layer.name: APC Compatibility Layer
APC Compatibility Layer.shortDescription: Compatibility layer for the APC extension
APC Compatibility Layer.longDescription: Compatibility layer for the APC extension, covering the main API methods of the APC extension

bcmath.name: bcmath
bcmath.longDescription: PHP offers the Binary Calculator which supports numbers of any size and precision, represented as strings.

bcmath.scale.shortDescription: Number of digits after decimal point for bcmath functions

bz2.name: bz2
bz2.longDescription: The bzip2 functions are used to transparently read and write bzip2 (.bz2) compressed files.

calendar.name: calendar
calendar.longDescription: The calendar extension presents a series of functions to simplify converting between different calendar formats. The intermediary or standard it is based on is the Julian Day Count.

cgi-fcgi.name: cgi-fcgi
cgi-fcgi.longDescription: This extension provides PHP CGI or FastCGI server API.

com_dotnet.name: com_dotnet
com_dotnet.longDescription: An object orientated layer (and associated services) on top of DCE RPC (an open standard) which defines a common calling convention that enables code written in any language to call and interoperate with code written in any other language.

com.allow_dcom.shortDescription: Operating PHP as a D-COM client

com.autoregister_typelib.shortDescription: Registration constants from the typelibrary of objects

com.autoregister_verbose.shortDescription: Reporting errors using the PHP error mechanism

com.autoregister_casesensitive.shortDescription: Constants found in auto-loaded type libraries will be registered case-s

com.code_page.shortDescription: Default character sets code-page to use when passing strings to/from COM

com.typelib_file.shortDescription: Path to a file that contains a list of typelibraries

crack.default_dictionary.shortDescription: Modify the directory location of the cracklib  dictionary files

ctype.name: ctype
ctype.longDescription: Checks whether a character or string falls into a certain character class according to the current locale.

curl.name: curl
curl.longDescription:
Allows you to connect to and communicate with many different types of servers with many different types of protocols. 
Note:
libcurl libraries must be installed in order for this extension to function.

curl.cainfo.shortDescription: A default value for the CURLOPT_CAINFO option. This is required to be an absolute path.

register_globals.shortDescription: Tells whether or not to register the EGPCS as global variables

register_argc_argv.shortDescription: Tells PHP whether to declare the argv & argc variables

post_max_size.shortDescription: Sets max size of post data allowed

variables_order.shortDescription: Set the order of the EGPCS variable parsing

track_vars.shortDescription: If enabled, then Environment, GET, POST, Cookie, and Server variables can be found in the global arrays

request_order.shortDescription: Describes the order in which PHP registers GET, POST and Cookie variables into the _REQUEST array

allow_webdav_methods.shortDescription: Allow handling of WebDAV http requests within PHP scripts

auto_prepend_file.shortDescription: Automatically prepend and parse a file to PHP

auto_append_file.shortDescription: Automatically append and parse a file to PHP

register_long_arrays.shortDescription: To register the deprecated long $HTTP_*_VARS type predefined variables

arg_separator.input.shortDescription: List of separator(s) used by PHP to parse input URLs into variables

arg_separator.output.shortDescription: The separator used in PHP generated URLs to separate arguments

auto_globals_jit.shortDescription: Initializing auto-globals on the first use or at the start of the request

enable_post_data_reading.shortDescription: Disabling this option causes $_POST and $_FILES not to be populated.

date.name: date
date.longDescription: Allows you to get the date from the server where your PHP scripts are running. You can use this function to format the date in various ways.

date.timezone.shortDescription: The default timezone used by all date/time functions if the TZ environment variable isn't set

dom.name: dom
dom.longDescription:
The DOM extension is the replacement for the DOM XML extension from PHP 4. The extension still contains many old functions, but they should no longer be used. In particular, functions that are not object-oriented should be avoided.
The extension allows you to operate on an XML document with the DOM API.

ereg.name: ereg
ereg.longDescription: Provides a set of string pattern matching functions using POSIX extended regular expressions.

display_errors.shortDescription: Display errors in HTML script output

warn_plus_overloading.shortDescription: Output a warning if plus operator is used with strings

error_prepend_string.shortDescription: String to output before an error message

error_append_string.shortDescription: String to output after an error message

error_log.shortDescription: Name of the file where script errors should be logged

log_errors_max_len.shortDescription: Set the maximum length of log_errors in bytes

ignore_repeated_source.shortDescription: Ignore source of message when ignoring repeated messages

report_memleaks.shortDescription: If this parameter is set to Off, then memory leaks will not be shown

html_errors.shortDescription: Turn off HTML tags in error messages

docref_root.shortDescription: The new error format contains a reference to a page describing the error

exif.name: exif
exif.longDescription: With the exif extension you are able to work with image meta data.

exif.decode_jis_intel.shortDescription: Defines the image internal characterset for JIS encoded user comments

exif.encode_unicode.shortDescription: Defines the characterset UNICODE user comments are handled

exif.decode_unicode_motorola.shortDescription: Image internal characterset for Unicode encoded user comments

exif.decode_unicode_intel.shortDescription: Image internal characterset for Unicode encoded user comments

exif.encode_jis.shortDescription: Characterset JIS user comments are handled

exif.decode_jis_motorola.shortDescription: Image internal characterset for JIS encoded user comments

Extension Directory Locations.name: Extension Directory Locations
Extension Directory Locations.longDescription: Defines directory locations for Zend components.

fbsql.default_host.shortDescription: The default server host to use when connecting to the database server

fbsql.default_user.shortDescription: The default user name to use when connecting to the database server

fileinfo.name: fileinfo
fileinfo.longDescription: Allows retrieval of information regarding various file types. This information includes file type and encoding, as well as more specific information such as dimensions, quality or length.

Filesystem and Streams.name: Filesystem and Streams
Filesystem and Streams.shortDescription: File System, Streams and Uploads Directives
Filesystem and Streams.longDescription: File System, Streams and Uploads Directives

allow_url_fopen.shortDescription: Enables the URL-aware fopen wrappers that enable accessing URL object like files

allow_url_include.shortDescription: This option allows the use of URL-aware fopen wrappers with the following functions: include(), include_once(), require(), require_once(). Requires allow_url_fopen to be on

default_socket_timeout.shortDescription: Default timeout (in seconds) for socket based streams

auto_detect_line_endings.shortDescription: When turned on, PHP will examine the data read by fgets() and file() to see if it is using Unix, MS-Dos or Macintosh line-ending conventions

user_agent.shortDescription: Define the user agent for PHP to send

file_uploads.shortDescription: Whether or not to allow HTTP file uploads

upload_tmp_dir.shortDescription: The temporary directory used for storing files when doing file upload

upload_max_filesize.shortDescription: The maximum size of an uploaded file

max_file_uploads.shortDescription: Maximum number of files that can be uploaded via a single request

filter.name: filter
filter.longDescription: Serves to validate and filter data coming from some insecure source, such as user inputs.

filter.default.shortDescription: Filter all $_GET, $_POST, $_COOKIE and $_REQUEST data by this filter

ftp.name: ftp
ftp.longDescription: The functions in this extension implement client access to file servers speaking the FTP. This extension is meant for detailed access to an FTP server providing a wide range of control to the executing script.

gd.name: gd
gd.longDescription: With the GD library of image functions PHP can be used to create and manipulate image files in a variety of different image formats, including gif, png, jpg, wbmp, and xpm. Even more conveniently, PHP can output image streams directly to a browser.

gd.jpeg_ignore_warning.shortDescription: Ignore warnings created by jpeg2wbmp() and imagecreatefromjpeg()

gettext.name: gettext

opcache.dups_fix.shortDescription: This hack should only be enabled to work around "Cannot redeclare class" errors.

opcache.log_verbosity_level.shortDescription: The verbosity of the OPcache log.

opcache.memory_consumption.shortDescription: The OPcache shared memory storage size. The amount of memory for storing precompiled PHP code in Mbytes.

opcache.interned_strings_buffer.shortDescription: The amount of memory used to store interned strings, in megabytes. This configuration directive is ignored in PHP < 5.3.0.

opcache.max_accelerated_files.shortDescription: The maximum number of keys (scripts) in the OPcache hash table.

opcache.max_wasted_percentage.shortDescription: The maximum percentage of "wasted" memory until a restart is scheduled.

opcache.consistency_checks.shortDescription: Check the cache checksum every N requests.

opcache.force_restart_timeout.shortDescription: Time duration (in seconds) for waiting for a scheduled restart to begin if the cache is not being accessed.

opcache.blacklist_filename.shortDescription: The location of the OPcache blacklist file.

opcache.error_log.shortDescription: The location of the OPcache error log file.

opcache.protect_memory.shortDescription: Protects shared memory from unexpected writes while executing scripts. This is useful for internal debugging only.

opcache.save_comments.shortDescription: If disabled, all PHPDoc comments are dropped from the code to reduce the size of the optimized code.

opcache.load_comments.shortDescription: If disabled, documentation comments won't be loaded from the opcode cache even if they exist.

opcache.fast_shutdown.shortDescription: If enabled, a fast shutdown sequence is used for the accelerated code.

opcache.optimization_level.shortDescription: A bitmask, where each bit enables or disables the appropriate OPcache passes.

opcache.max_file_size.shortDescription: The maximum file size that will be cached, in bytes. If this is 0, all files will be cached.

zend_optimizerplus.enable.shortDescription: Optimizer+ On/Off switch. When set to Off, code is not optimized.

zend_optimizerplus.use_cwd.shortDescription: If set to On, use the current directory as a part of the script key.

zend_optimizerplus.validate_timestamps.shortDescription: If enabled, the Optimizer+ checks the file timestamps and updates the cache accordingly.

zend_optimizerplus.revalidate_freq.shortDescription: How often to check file timestamps for changes to the shared memory storage allocation.

zend_optimizerplus.revalidate_path.shortDescription: Enables or disables file search in include_path optimization

zend_optimizerplus.inherited_hack.shortDescription: Enable this hack as a workaround for "can't redeclare class" errors

zend_optimizerplus.dups_fix.shortDescription: Enable this hack as a workaround for "duplicate definition" errors.

zend_optimizerplus.log_verbosity_level.shortDescription: The verbosity of the Optimizer+ log.

zend_optimizerplus.memory_consumption.shortDescription: The Optimizer+ shared memory storage size. The amount of memory for storing precompiled PHP code in Mbytes.

zend_optimizerplus.interned_strings_buff.shortDescription: The amount of memory for interned strings in Mbytes.

zend_optimizerplus.max_accelerated_files.shortDescription: The maximum number of keys (scripts) in the Optimizer+ hash table.

zend_optimizerplus.max_wasted_percentage.shortDescription: The maximum percentage of "wasted" memory until a restart is scheduled.

zend_optimizerplus.consistency_checks.shortDescription: Check the cache checksum each N requests.

zend_optimizerplus.force_restart_timeout.shortDescription: Time duration (in seconds) for waiting for a scheduled restart to begin if the cache is not being accessed.

zend_optimizerplus.blacklist_filename.shortDescription: The location of the Optimizer+ blacklist file.

zend_optimizerplus.protect_memory.shortDescription: Protect the shared memory from writing during script execution.

zend_optimizerplus.save_comments.shortDescription: If disabled, all PHPDoc comments are dropped from the code to reduce the size of the optimized code.

zend_optimizerplus.fast_shutdown.shortDescription: If enabled, a fast shutdown sequence is used for the accelerated code.

zend_optimizerplus.optimization_level.shortDescription: A bitmask, where each bit enables or disables the appropriate Optimizer+ passes.

zend_optimizerplus.enable_slow_optimizat.shortDescription: Enables or disables the optimization passes that may take a significant amount of time, based on an internal runtime calculation.

openssl.name: openssl
openssl.longDescription:
This module uses the functions of >>OpenSSL for generation and verification of signatures and for sealing (encrypting) and opening (decrypting) data.
Note:
OpenSSL libraries must be installed in order for this extension to function.
See Appendix F - Loading the mod_ssl Module for more on enabling SSL Support on Apache.

overload.name: overload
overload.shortDescription: The purpose of this extension is to allow overloading of object property access and method calls

include_path.shortDescription: List of directories where PHP looks for files

doc_root.shortDescription: Root directory of PHP on the server

user_dir.shortDescription: The base name of the directory used on a home directory for PHP file

extension_dir.shortDescription: In what directory PHP should look for dynamically loadable extensions

cgi.force_redirect.shortDescription: Provides security running PHP as a CGI under

cgi.check_shebang_line.shortDescription: Controls whether CGI PHP checks for line starting with #! (shebang) at the top of the running script

cgi.nph.shortDescription: Forces cgi to always sent Status: 200 with every request

cgi.redirect_status_env.shortDescription: According to this status PHP knows it is OK to continue execution

fastcgi.logging.shortDescription: Make logging to fastcgi's stderr optional

fastcgi.impersonate.shortDescription: Ability to impersonate security tokens of the calling client

cgi.rfc2616_headers.shortDescription: Type of headers to use when sending HTTP response code

pcntl.name: pcntl
pcntl.longDescription: Process Control support in PHP implements the Unix style of process creation, program execution, signal handling and process termination. Process Control should not be enabled within a Webserver environment and unexpected results may happen if any Process Control functions are used within a Webserver environment.

pcre.name: pcre
pcre.longDescription: The syntax for patterns used in these functions closely resembles Perl.

PDO.name: PDO
PDO.longDescription: This extension defines a lightweight, consistent interface for accessing databases in PHP. Each database driver that implements the PDO interface can expose database-specific features as regular extension functions.

pdo_dblib.name: pdo_dblib
pdo_dblib.longDescription: PDO_DBLIB is a driver that implements the PHP Data Objects (PDO) interface to enable access from PHP to Microsoft SQL Server and Sybase databases through the FreeTDS libary.

pdo_ibm.name: pdo_ibm
pdo_ibm.longDescription: PDO_IBM is a driver that implements the PHP Data Objects (PDO) interface to enable access from PHP to IBM databases.

pdo_informix.name: pdo_informix
pdo_informix.longDescription: PDO_Informix is a driver that implements the PHP Data Objects (PDO) interface to enable access from PHP to Informix databases.

pdo_mysql.name: pdo_mysql
pdo_mysql.longDescription: The PDO_MYSQL is a driver that allows access to MySQL 3.x/4.0 databases.

pdo_mysql.cache_size.shortDescription: If mysqlnd is used: Number of cache slots for the internal result set cache

pdo_mysql.default_socket.shortDescription: Default socket name for local MySQL connects.  If empty, uses the built-in MySQL defaults

PDO_OCI.name: PDO_OCI
PDO_OCI.longDescription: PDP_OCI is a driver that implements the PHP Data Objects (PDO) interface to enable access from PHP to Oracle databases through the OCI library.

PDO_ODBC.name: PDO_ODBC
PDO_ODBC.shortDescription: ODBC Drivers/IBM DB2 CLI PHP-Database Access
PDO_ODBC.longDescription: PDO_ODBC is a driver that enables access from PHP to different databases through ODBC drivers or through the IBM DB2 Call Level Interface (DB2 CLI) library.

pdo_pgsql.name: pdo_pgsql
pdo_pgsql.longDescription: PDO_PGSQL is a driver that implements the PHP Data Objects (PDO) interface to enable access from PHP to PostgreSQL databases.

pdo_sqlite.name: pdo_sqlite
pdo_sqlite.longDescription: PDO_SQLITE is a driver that implements the PHP Data Objects (PDO) interface to enable access from PHP to SQLite databases.

pgsql.name: pgsql
pgsql.longDescription: Provides access to the PostgreSQL databases.

pgsql.allow_persistent.shortDescription: Whether to allow persistent Postgres connections

pgsql.max_persistent.shortDescription: Maximum number of persistent PostgresSQL connections

pgsql.max_links.shortDescription: The maximum number of Postgres connections per process

pgsql.auto_reset_persistent.shortDescription: Detect broken persistent links with pg_pconnect()

pgsql.ignore_notice.shortDescription: Whether or not to log PostgreSQL backends notice messages

pgsql.log_notice.shortDescription: Whether or not to log PostgreSQL backends notice messages

Phar.name: Phar
Phar.longDescription: This extension provides a way to put entire PHP applications into a single file called a "phar" (PHP Archive) for easy distribution and installation.

phar.readonly.shortDescription: This option disables creation or modification of Phar archives using the phar stream or Phar  object's write support

phar.require_hash.shortDescription: This option will force all opened Phar archives to contain some kind of signature (currently MD5, SHA1, SHA256 and SHA512 are supported), and will refuse to process any Phar archive that does not contain a signature

phar.extract_list.shortDescription: Allows mappings from a full path to a phar archive or its alias to the location of its extracted files

phar.cache_list.shortDescription: Allows mapping phar archives to be pre-parsed at web server startup, providing a performance improvement that brings running files out of a phar archive very close to the speed of running those files from a traditional disk-based installation

posix.name: posix
posix.longDescription:
Contains an interface to those functions defined in the IEEE 1003.1 (POSIX.1) standards document which are not accessible through other means.
Warning: Sensitive data can be retrieved with the POSIX functions, e.g. posix_getpwnam() and friends. None of the POSIX functions perform any kind of access checking when safe mode is enabled. It's therefore strongly advised to disable the POSIX extension.

pspell.name: pspell
pspell.longDescription: These functions allow you to check the spelling of a word and offer suggestions.

Reflection.name: Reflection
Reflection.longDescription: PHP 5 comes with a complete reflection API that adds the ability to reverse-engineer classes, interfaces, functions and methods as well as extensions. The reflection API also offers ways of retrieving doc comments for functions, classes and methods.

Resource Limits and Tuning.name: Resource Limits and Tuning
Resource Limits and Tuning.shortDescription: Resource Limits and Performance Tuning Directives
Resource Limits and Tuning.longDescription: Resource Limits and Performance Tuning Directives

max_execution_time.shortDescription: Maximum time in seconds a script is allowed to run before it is terminated

max_input_nesting_level.shortDescription: Sets the max nesting dept of input variables (i.e. $_GET, $_POST..)

memory_limit.shortDescription: Maximum of amount of memory in bytes that a script is allowed to allocate

max_input_time.shortDescription: Maximum time in seconds a script is allowed to receive input data

max_input_vars.shortDescription: How many input variables may be accepted. Use of this directive mitigates the possibility of denial of service attacks which use hash collisions. If there are more input variables than specified by this directive, an E_WARNING is issued, and further input variables are truncated from the request. This limit applies only to each nesting level of a multi-dimensional input array.

realpath_cache_size.shortDescription: Determines the size of the realpath cache to be used by PHP

realpath_cache_ttl.shortDescription: Duration of time for which to cache realpath information for a given file or directory

safe_mode.shortDescription: Whether to enable safe mode of PHP

safe_mode_allowed_env_vars.shortDescription: Setting certain environment variables may be a potential security breach

safe_mode_protected_env_vars.shortDescription: Environment variables that are not changeable using putenv()

disable_functions.shortDescription: This directive allows you to disable certain functions for security reasons

safe_mode_gid.shortDescription: Whether to enable PHP safe mode

safe_mode_include_dir.shortDescription: UID/GID checks are bypassed when including files from this directory and it

disable_classes.shortDescription: This directive allows you to disable certain classes for security reasons

open_basedir.shortDescription: Limit the files that can be opened by PHP to the specified directory-tree

zend_sc.daemon.enable.shortDescription: Should the daemon start in normal run or stand by.

zend_sc.daemon.log_rotation_size.shortDescription: The maximum size of the log file before it is rotated.

zend_sc.network.hostname.shortDescription: The identification of the running machine.

zend_sc.network.tcp_port_remote.shortDescription: The port via which the daemon will receive connections from other daemons.

zend_sc.network.use_unix_sockets.shortDescription: Communication with the mod cluster: 0 TCP, 1 Unix socket.

zend_sc.network.tcp_port_local.shortDescription: The TCP port SC daemon listens to communicate with the local mod cluster.

zend_sc.network.unix_socket_permissions.shortDescription: When the daemon is run, it creates a scd.sock file with these permissions [octal permission].

zend_sc.debug.logs_cache_enable.shortDescription: For Zend Support Only. Enable/Disable cache log. Buffer to hold the log messages before dumping them to the log

zend_sc.debug.log_cache_size.shortDescription: For Zend Support Only. Size of the log cache buffer in number of lines

zend_sc.debug.time_for_verbosity_level_f.shortDescription: For Zend Support Only. Time in seconds of verbosity level 5 after the dropping of the log cache buffer

zend_sc.debug.error_ids_list.shortDescription: For Zend Support Only. A comma separated list of error ids. These error ids indicate when to drop the log buffer.

zend_sc.ha.udp_port.shortDescription: Port which is used for broadcasts for things like graceful shutdown and HA.

zend_sc.ha.use_broadcast.shortDescription: Indicate whether notifications between the cluster daemons should be done using broadcast or unicast.

zend_sc.allowed_hosts.shortDescription: A comma separated list of IPs or IP masks. These masks indicate with which machines the daemon will both agree to connect to and agree to receive connections from (this list is used for both broadcast and unicast methods).

zend_sc.ha.cluster_members.shortDescription: Comma separated list of IPs to indicate which nodes are members of the cluster (this list is used when the use_broadcast directive is set to 0).

zend_sc.garbage_collection_delta.shortDescription: The time interval (in seconds) between two executions of the garbage collector.

zend_sc.statistics_delta_minutes.shortDescription: The time interval (in minutes) between statistics dump to the log file.

zend_sc.storage.memory_cache_size.shortDescription: Specifies the number of bytes for memory caching of sessions.

zend_sc.storage.flush_delta.shortDescription: The frequency at which sessions are flushed.

zend_sc.storage.save_path.shortDescription: The location on the disk where the saved sessions are stored.

zend_sc.storage.dir_levels.shortDescription: Specifies the number of directory levels used in saving files.

zend_sc.storage.filename_cache_num_entri.shortDescription: The number of entries in an internal cache.

zend_sc.message_server_port.shortDescription: The port on which the daemon listens for control messages.

zend_sc.graceful_transfer_max_size.shortDescription: The maximum size of a chunk of sessions when transferring to the replacment server during a graceful shutdown.

zend_sc.graceful_max_time.shortDescription: The maximum time allowed for a graceful shutdown to take place.

zend_sc.graceful_transfer_port.shortDescription: The port used by the daemon to transfer sessions to its replacement server.

zend_sc.graceful_compress_chunks.shortDescription: Compress each check of sessions before transfer.

zend_sc.graceful_primary_replacement.shortDescription: Primary replacement server for graceful shutdown.

zend_sc.graceful_secondary_replacement.shortDescription: Secondary replacement server for graceful shutdown.

zend_sc.relay_session_timeout.shortDescription: Defines the timeout for relay sessions (in seconds). If 0 is set, then no timeout is used.

zend_sc.use_cpu_load.shortDescription: For machine load - use CPU percenatege instead of open connections count.

session.name: session
session.longDescription: Session support in PHP consists of a way to preserve certain data across subsequent accesses.

session.save_handler.shortDescription: Name of the handler which is used for storing and retrieving data associate

session.save_path.shortDescription: Argument which is passed to the save handler

session.use_cookies.shortDescription: Using cookies to store the session id on the client side

session.name.shortDescription: Name of the session which is used as cookie name

session.cookie_httponly.shortDescription: Access the cookie only through the HTTP protocol

session.use_strict_mode.shortDescription: Specifies whether the module will use strict session id mode

session.gc_maxlifetime.shortDescription: Number of seconds after which data will be seen as garbage and cleaned up

session.referer_check.shortDescription: Substring you want to check each HTTP Referer for

session.entropy_length.shortDescription: Number of bytes which will be read from the file specified above

session.entropy_file.shortDescription: Path to an external resource using as an additional entropy source

session.cache_limiter.shortDescription: Cache control method to use for session pages

session.cache_expire.shortDescription: Time-to-live for cached session pages in minutes

session.use_trans_sid.shortDescription: Whether transparent sid support is enabled or not

session.gc_divisor.shortDescription: Probability that the gc process is started on every session initialization

session.bug_compat_42.shortDescription: Initializating of session variable in the global scope

session.bug_compat_warn.shortDescription: Initializating a session variable in the global scope

session.hash_function.shortDescription: Specify the hash algorithm used to generate the session IDs

session.hash_bits_per_character.shortDescription: Number of stored bits per character when converting binary hash data

url_rewriter.tags.shortDescription: HTML tags are rewritten to include session id

session.use_only_cookies.shortDescription: Using only cookies to store the session id on the client side

session.cookie_secure.shortDescription: Whether cookies should only be sent over secure connections

session.upload_progress.enabled.shortDescription: Enables upload progress tracking, populating the $_SESSION variable. Defaults to 1, enabled.

session.upload_progress.cleanup.shortDescription: Cleanup the progress information as soon as all POST data has been read (i.e. upload completed). Defaults to 1, enabled.

session.upload_progress.prefix.shortDescription: A prefix used for the upload progress key in the $_SESSION. This key will be concatenated with the value of $_POST[ini_get("session.upload_progress.name")] to provide a unique index. Defaults to "upload_progress_".

session.upload_progress.name.shortDescription: The name of the key to be used in $_SESSION storing the progress information. See also session.upload_progress.prefix. If $_POST[ini_get("session.upload_progress.name")] is not passed or available, upload progressing will not be recorded. Defaults to "PHP_SESSION_UPLOAD_PROGRESS".

session.upload_progress.freq.shortDescription: Defines how often the upload progress information should be updated. This can be defined in bytes (i.e. "update progress information after every 100 bytes"), or in percentages (i.e. "update progress information after receiving every 1% of the whole filesize"). Defaults to "1%".

session.upload_progress.min_freq.shortDescription: The minimum delay between updates, in seconds. Defaults to "1" (one second).

shmop.name: shmop
shmop.longDescription: Shmop is an easy-to-use set of functions that allows PHP to read, write, create and delete Unix shared memory segments.

SimpleXML.name: SimpleXML
SimpleXML.longDescription:
The SimpleXML extension provides a very simple and easily usable toolset to convert XML to an object that can be processed with normal property selectors and array iterators.
Note:
libxml libraries must be installed in order for this extension to function.

soap.name: soap
soap.longDescription:
This extension can be used to write SOAP Servers and Clients.
Note:
libxml libraries must be installed in order for this extension to function.

soap.wsdl_cache_enabled.shortDescription: Enables or disables WSDL caching feature

soap.wsdl_cache_dir.shortDescription: Sets the directory name where SOAP extension will put cache files

soap.wsdl_cache_ttl.shortDescription: Number of second while cached file will be used instead of original

soap.wsdl_cache.shortDescription: If soap.wsdl_cache_enabled  is on, this setting determines the type of caching

soap.wsdl_cache_limit.shortDescription: Maximum number of in-memory cached WSDL files

sockets.name: sockets
sockets.longDescription: The socket extension implements a low-level interface to the socket communication functions based on the popular BSD sockets, providing the possibility to act as a socket server as well as a client.

sockets.use_system_read.shortDescription: Use the system read() function instead of the php_read() wrapper

SPL.name: SPL
SPL.longDescription: Standard PHP Library(SPL) is a collection of interfaces and classes that are meant to solve standard problems.

SQLite.name: SQLite
SQLite.longDescription: This is an extension for the SQLite Embeddable SQL Database Engine. SQLite is a C library that implements an embeddable SQL database engine. Programs that link with the SQLite library can have SQL database access without running a separate RDBMS process.

sqlite.assoc_case.shortDescription: Whether the names of the columns are returned in their natural case or as uppercase or lowercase indexes

sqlite3.name: sqlite3
sqlite3.longDescription: This extension provides support for SQLite version 3 databases.

sqlite3.extension_dir.shortDescription: Path to the directory where the loadable extensions for SQLite reside

sqlsrv.name: sqlsrv
sqlsrv.longDescription: The SQL Server 2005 Driver for PHP is a PHP 5 extension that provides data access to SQL Server 2005 and SQL Server 2008. The extension provides a procedural interface for accessing data in all versions (including Express) of SQL Server 2005 and SQL Server 2008. The SQL Server 2005 Driver for PHP API includes support for Windows Authentication, transactions, parameter binding, streaming, metadata access, and error handling.

sqlsrv.LogSeverity.shortDescription: The LogSeverity setting is used to specify what to log after logging has been turned on.

sqlsrv.LogSubsystems.shortDescription: The LogSubsystems setting is used to turn on logging for subsystems.

sqlsrv.WarningsReturnAsErrors.shortDescription: The WarningsReturnAsErrors option is used to specify whether warnings generated by calls to sqlsrv functions are treated as errors.

ssh2.name: ssh2
ssh2.longDescription: Provides bindings to the functions of libssh2 which implements the SSH2 protocol.

sybase.max_persistent.shortDescription: Maximum number of persistent Sybase connections

sybase.max_links.shortDescription: Maximum number of all Sybase connections

sybct.max_persistent.shortDescription: Maximum number of persistent Sybase-CT connections

sybct.max_links.shortDescription: Maximum number of all Sybase-CT connections

sybct.min_server_severity.shortDescription: Sybase-CT minimum server message severity displayed

sybct.min_client_severity.shortDescription: Sybase-CT minimum client message severity displayed

sybct.login_timeout.shortDescription: The maximum time in seconds to wait for a connection attempt to succeed before returning failure

sybct.hostname.shortDescription: The name of the host you claim to be connecting from, for display by sp_who

sybct.deadlock_retry_count.shortDescription: Allows you to to define how often deadlocks are to be retried

sysvmsg.name: sysvmsg
sysvmsg.longDescription: Enables System V messages support - The messaging functions may be used to send and receive messages to/from other processes. They provide a simple and effective means of exchanging data between processes, without the need for setting up an alternative using Unix domain sockets.

sysvsem.name: sysvsem
sysvsem.longDescription: Enables System V semaphore support - Semaphores may be used to provide exclusive access to resources on the current machine, or to limit the number of processes that may simultaneously use a resource.

sysvshm.name: sysvshm
sysvshm.longDescription: Enables System V shared memory support - Shared memory may be used to provide access to global variables.

thrift_protocol.name: thrift_protocol
thrift_protocol.longDescription: Thrift is a software framework for scalable cross-language services development. Thrift allows you to define data types and service interfaces in a simple definition file.

tidy.name: tidy
tidy.longDescription:
Tidy is a binding for the Tidy HTML clean and repair utility which allows you to not only clean and otherwise manipulate HTML documents, but also traverse the document tree.
Note:
libtidy libraries must be installed in order for this extension to function.

tidy.clean_output.shortDescription: Turns on/off the output repairing by Tidy

tidy.default_config.shortDescription: Default path for tidy config file

tokenizer.name: tokenizer
tokenizer.longDescription: The tokenizer functions provide an interface to the PHP tokenizer embedded in the Zend Engine. Using these functions you may write your own PHP source analyzing or modification tools without having to deal with the language specification at the lexical level.

uploadprogress.name: uploadprogress
uploadprogress.longDescription: An extension to track progress of a file upload.

wddx.name: wddx
wddx.longDescription:
This extension includes functions intended for work with the Web Distributed Data Exchange(WDDX), a free and open XML-based technology allowing Web applications to easily exchange data with one another.
Note:
expat (Apache) libraries must be installed in order for this extension to function.

win32service.name: win32service
win32service.longDescription: The win32service extension is a Windows specific extension that allows PHP to communicate with the Service Control Manager to start, stop, register and unregister services, and even allows your PHP scripts to run as a service.

xdebug.name: xdebug
xdebug.longDescription: Xdebug is a PHP extension which provides debugging and profiling capabilities

xdebug.auto_trace.shortDescription: When this setting is set to on, the tracing of function calls will be enabled just before the script is run. This makes it possible to trace code in the auto_prepend_file.

xdebug.collect_assignments.shortDescription: This setting, defaulting to 0, controls whether Xdebug should add variable assignments to function traces.

xdebug.collect_includes.shortDescription: This setting, defaulting to 1, controls whether Xdebug should write the filename used in include(), include_once(), require() or require_once() to the trace files.

xdebug.collect_params.shortDescription: This setting, defaulting to 0, controls whether Xdebug should collect the parameters passed to functions when a function call is recorded in either the function trace or the stack trace.

xdebug.collect_return.shortDescription: This setting, defaulting to 0, controls whether Xdebug should write the return value of function calls to the trace files.

xdebug.collect_vars.shortDescription: This setting tells Xdebug to gather information about which variables are used in a certain scope.

xdebug.coverage_enable.shortDescription: If this setting is set to 0, then Xdebug will not set-up internal structures to allow code coverage.

xdebug.default_enable.shortDescription: If this setting is 1, then stacktraces will be shown by default on an error event.

xdebug.dump.COOKIE.shortDescription: These settings controls which data from the COOKIE superglobal is shown when an error situation occurs.

xdebug.dump.FILES.shortDescription: These settings controls which data from the FILES superglobal is shown when an error situation occurs.

xdebug.dump.GET.shortDescription: These settings controls which data from the GET superglobal is shown when an error situation occurs.

xdebug.dump.POST.shortDescription: These settings controls which data from the POST superglobal is shown when an error situation occurs.

xdebug.dump.REQUEST.shortDescription: These settings controls which data from the REQUEST superglobal is shown when an error situation occurs.

xdebug.dump.SERVER.shortDescription: These settings controls which data from the SERVER superglobal is shown when an error situation occurs.

xdebug.dump.SESSION.shortDescription: These settings controls which data from the SESSION superglobal is shown when an error situation occurs.

xdebug.dump_globals.shortDescription: Controls whether the values of the superglobals as defined by the xdebug.dump.* settings whould be shown or not.

xdebug.dump_once.shortDescription: Controls whether the values of the superglobals should be dumped on all error situations (set to 0) or only on the first (set to 1).

xdebug.dump_undefined.shortDescription: If you want to dump undefined values from the superglobals you should set this setting to 1, otherwise leave it set to 0.

xdebug.extended_info.shortDescription: Controls whether Xdebug should enforce 'extended_info' mode for the PHP parser

xdebug.file_link_format.shortDescription: This setting determines the format of the links that are made in the display of stack traces where file names are used.

xml.name: xml
xml.longDescription: XML (Extensible Markup Language) is a data format for structured document interchange on the Web. This toolkit lets you parse, but not validate, XML documents. This extension lets you create XML parsers and then define handlers for different XML events.

xmlreader.name: xmlreader
xmlreader.longDescription:
XML Reader - The XMLReader extension is an XML Pull parser. The reader acts as a cursor going forward on the document stream and stopping at each node on the way.
Note:
libxml libraries must be installed in order for this extension to function.

xmlrpc.name: xmlrpc
xmlrpc.longDescription:
XML-RPC allows software running on disparate operating systems and in different environments to make procedure calls over the Web. This extension includes functions that can be used to write XML-RPC servers and clients.
Warning: This extension is experimental. The behavior of this extension may change without notice in a future release of PHP. Use this extension at your own risk.

xmlrpc_errors.shortDescription: Turns off normal error reporting and formats errors as XML-RPC error message

xmlrpc_error_number.shortDescription: Use as the value of the XML-RPC faultCode element

xmlwriter.name: xmlwriter
xmlwriter.longDescription: Represents a writer that provides a non-cached, forward-only means of generating streams or files containing XML data. This extension can be used in an object oriented style or a procedural one. Every method documented describes the alternative procedural call.

xsl.name: xsl
xsl.longDescription:
This extension implements the Extensible Stylesheet Language(XSL) standard, performing XSLT transformations using the libxslt library.
Note:
libxslt libraries must be installed in order for this extension to function.

zend_deployment.daemon.log_rotation_size.shortDescription: The maximum size of the log file before it is rotated.

zend_deployment.operations.retry_count.shortDescription: Number of retries that will be used for all operations failures.

zend_deployment.server_hooks_dir.shortDescription: Path to the server wide scripts directory.

zend_deployment.hook_script_php_binary.shortDescription: Sets the PHP binary used for executing deployment hook scripts (with optional arguments).

zend_deployment.health_check_frequency.shortDescription: The frequency in which health checks are executed.

zend_deployment.create_env_file.shortDescription: Should the daemon create an environment file of deployment scripts.

zend_deployment.tasks_check_interval.shortDescription: The frequency in which new tasks are retrieved.

zend_deployment.defined_apps_detection_i.shortDescription: The frequency in which defined applications are detected.

zip.name: zip
zip.longDescription:
Enables you to transparently read ZIP compressed archives and the files inside them.
Note:
Zlib libraries must be installed in order for this extension to function.

zlib.name: zlib
zlib.longDescription: Enables you to transparently read and write gzip (.gz) compressed files, through versions of most of the filesystem functions which work with gzip-compressed files (and uncompressed files without sockets).

zlib.output_compression_level.shortDescription: Compression level used for transparent output compression

Zmail.name: Zmail
Zmail.shortDescription: PHP Email API for IBM i
Zmail.longDescription: A PHP extension that implements an SMTP client. In IBM i it takes over php's mail() function and handles all calls to this function.

zend_server_daemon.log_rotation_size.shortDescription: The maximum size of the log file before it is rotated

zend_server_daemon.scan_dirs.shortDescription: Semi colon list of directories containing the Zend Server INI files

zend_server_daemon.exclude_directives.shortDescription: Semi colon list of directives that will be excluded from the blueprint

zend_server_daemon.cluster_node_id.shortDescription: Stores the last node id for this node when in single server mode

zend_server_daemon.node_ip.shortDescription: Stores the current node's external IP address

zend_server_daemon.blueprint_check_inter.shortDescription: Set the blueprint check interval, in seconds

zend_server_daemon.tasks_check_interval.shortDescription: Set the tasks polling interval, in seconds

zend_server_daemon.keep_alive_interval.shortDescription: Sets the interval between reporting of the 'I am alive' record. in seconds

zend_server_daemon.restart_strategy.shortDescription: The Zend Server Cluster restart strategy. 0 means restart N servers at a time, 1 means restart N% servers at a time

zend_server_daemon.restart_strategy_valu.shortDescription: The number / % of Zend Servers to restart at a time

zend_server_daemon.seconds_to_wait_for_s.shortDescription: Seconds to wait until session clustering completed its graceful shutdown

zend_server_daemon.webserver_config_file.shortDescription: Contains the path to the webserver configuration file (e.g. /etc/apache2/apache2.conf)

zend_server_daemon.webserver.error_repor.shortDescription: Error reporting level on the web server configuration problems

zend_server_daemon.webserver.fpm_restart.shortDescription: Minimal wait time between consecutive php-fpm restarts
